alert.note: Alert for Hempstead; Howard; Little River; Miller; Sevier (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 1:43AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Hempstead, Sevier, Howard, Little River, northwestern Miller, eastern McCurtain, Marion, Franklin, Bowie, Upshur, Titus, northern Smith, Cass, northwestern Harrison, Wood, Morris, Camp, Gregg and southeastern Red River Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 143 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mccauley to 7 miles northeast of De Kalb to near Hawkins. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Longview, Texarkana, Marshall, De Queen, White Oak, Gladewater, Atlanta, Wake Village, Gilmer, Ashdown, Nashville, New Boston, Mineola, Pittsburg, Winnsboro, Mineral Springs, Dierks, Horatio, Foreman and Boxelder. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
